full_text:
Editable List Views

Lesson
objectives

* Configure a List View to be editable
¢ Configure a List View so that rows can be
added to and removed from it

User Story — Editable List Views Gi

“TrainingApp users have to be :
able to manually add and remove [ro
policy summaries. When the user
clicks the Add button, TrainingApp
should create an empty row and
allow the user to specify the
details. The checkboxes should
be visible only when the List View
is in edit mode.”

- Insurance company
business analysts

Configuring the Add and Remove
buttons

I Iterator Buttons widget

¢ Iterator Buttons widget contains two buttons: Add and Remove

¢ It provides functionality

* To add new rows with the Add iterator button

* To remove existing rows with the Remove iterator button

¢ The buttons already have the appropriate visibility and availability logic

a

Person: William Andy

Details

0)

I Toolbars Gi

* There is more than one place that a toolbar could go
¢ Best place for Edit Buttons is the screen level toolbar
* Edit Buttons control the screen transaction
¢ Best place for Iterator Buttons is the toolbar closest to the List View
* This is typically the toolbar associated with the List View to display the paginator
* Depending on the complexity of the screen there could be only one toolbar containing both

widgets —— ro.) ra meniey a

Details Details

Person nfo | Phone &Addresses | wank Accounts

Bank wame~ Routing Number*

Person info | Phone saddresses | dank Accounts

Routing Number > Account Number Account Number™

123-987 345678900 ‘ACME Credit Union 123.987 345676500

National Bank 745-222 232328566
ok 145-222 232323566

I Iterator buttons and row iterators Gi

* Properties of Row Iterator govern functionality of Iterator buttons (Add/Remove)

* toAdd - action to take when Add is clicked
* toRemove - action to take when Remove is clicked

Pontes = Properties
Row Iterator
Person: Willam Andy

Basic properties

editable* Details

clementName* Person info | Phone &Addresses | Bank Accounts

id

toCreateAndAdd 11 Bankwar Routing Number* ‘Account Number* >
toRemove jit Union 123-987 345678900

National Bank 745-222 232323566

I Iterator buttons and row iterators Gi

Typical configuration

¢ The typical method for the Add button is shown here, which is used when the List
View displays all the fields that need to be initialized
¢ The user clicks the Update button, which puts the screen in edit mode

¢ The user clicks the Add button, and a new empty row is inserted in the List View.
The user can initialize the row by simply editing the cells.

Persone Willom Andy (a .0) Persone Wiliam Andy V4

Details Details
Person info | Phone &Addresses Bank Accounts Person info | Phone &Addresses | Bank Accounts

Routing Number > Account Number 1) Bank wame* Routing Number” ‘Account Number*

jon 123-987 345678900 ‘ACME Credit Union 123-987 345676900

National Bank 745-222 232323566
National Bank 745-222, 232323566

e:

= = List View panel is editable
Routing Number =

Row Iterator is editable

RJ | ACME Credit Union 123-987 Checking ~~ Pending ~=—=—(06/19/2018
Row is editable

Cell is editable

National Bank 745-222 232323566 Checking Pending 06/19/2018

¢ For acell to be editable, only the row iterator needs to be explicitly set to editable
¢ List View Panel and Row can inherit editable from parent

¢ List view panels can include editable cells and non-editable cells
« Routing Number is editable

* Created On is read-only

I Demonstration G

Editable List Views

click here

Note: The demonstration opens a new tab in your browser. When the demonstration ends, the
original course launch window appears. Return to this window to continue this presentation.

Review Questions

Question

_- — Fora cell to be editable, the cell’s Editable property must be set to true.
Y What other elements, if any, must also be editable to make the cell
editable in the user interface?

SS eee ese ees SeeseseS

Gi

Answer Gi

_- — Fora cell to be editable, the cell’s Editable property must be set to true.
Y What other elements, if any, must also be editable to make the cell
editable in the user interface?

The List View Panel’s Row Iterator Editable property must be set to true.

en

Question

,- — When you drag an Iterator Buttons widget onto a toolbar, how many
Y buttons are added?

SS eee ese ees SeeseseS

Gi

Answer

,- — When you drag an Iterator Buttons widget onto a toolbar, how many
Y buttons are added?

Two: Add and Remove

en

Gi

Question

,- — Assume that an object called
Y anABContact has an Addresses array
and an Addresses list view panel whose
Row lterator is configured as shown.
Identify the errors in how the property is
configured.

SS eee ese ees SeeseseS

Answer

,- — Assume that an object called
Y anABContact has an Addresses array
and an Addresses list view panel whose
Row lterator is configured as shown.
Identify the errors in how the property is
configured.

There are four errors:
1. The object is anABContact, not ABContact.
2. The method name starts with "addTo...", not "toAdd...".

3. The name of the array is missing from the end of the method name. (The method should
be addToAddresses.)

4. The argument must reference the row iterator's element name, which is currentAddress.

en

Lesson
objectives * Configure a List View to be editable

review ¢ Configure a List View so that rows can be
added to and removed from it

I Student exercise

Editable List Views

=A
